intro: Tropaeolum unilobatum, commonly known as the single-lobed nasturtium, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, edible flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features include alternate, simple leaves and a flowering period that occurs in the summer months. Tropaeolum unilobatum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and as a culinary plant due to its peppery flavor.
